Key Match Events: Cole Anthony scored 14 out of a total of 24 points in the second half as Orlando Magic won over New York Knicks with a score of 103-94.
Total Carter Jr. scored 19 points from the bench, while Kentavideny Badminton-Pope added 15 points and Jonathan Isaac contributed 13 points to Magic.
Josh Hart recorded double-doubles with 15 points and 14 rebounds for the Knicks.
Jalen Brunson and Mikal Bridges each contributed 24 points for the Knicks.
Knicks recorded their lowest three-point shot percentage this season, only 18.2 percent (4 out of 22).
Knicks failed to score three points in 15 consecutive attempts before Cameron Payne slotted a three-point shot at the last second.
Jett Howard gave Magic a lead that was no longer overtaken by a three-point shot before the buzzer, making the score 53-51.
Anthony scored eight points in the third quarter as Magic outperformed Knicks 22-17.
Mikal Bridges brought the Knicks closer with a score of 83-78 through a jump shot at 7:53 in the fourth quarter.
Badminton-Pope answered with a three-point shot, and Carter added two points after Bridges failed to score.
